result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Emmanuel Marquis Jones

records.addlTxt:
Defendant is not in court. Guardian of the defendant is in court. Guardian informs the court that the defendant has been admitted into a group home and the group home was unable to provide transportation for this court date. The guardian requests an adjournment. Court grants the adjournment request. Parties advised of the new date and time. Case remains calendared in OCCR.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/28/22 @ 1p
